que0.question: Whats one question you should ask during a sales call?

options.a: What their problems/needs are
options.b: What's their networth?
options.c: Are they free to talk again next week?

que0.question: How should you onboard your clients?

options.a: You don't need to do that
options.b: Send them a google drive link with information they need to fill out and instructions for files they need to upload.
options.c: Send them the payment link only, you don't need more information.

options.a: Speed is the foundation of success in business and life in general
options.b: Speed is overrated. Because if you do things fast the quality degrades. It's basically impossible to do something really quickly AND do it well.
options.c: Meh, not really bro. Just chill out. Things happen when they happen you know. Can you pass me the joint?

que1.question: What's the best solution to the vast majority of problems that you'll encounter in life and business?

options.a: Hope and pray.
options.b: Throw money at it.
options.c: Take massive action.

options.a: A beautiful logo, carefully crafted website, enough inventory to handle months of demand, a nice office and lots of staff.
options.b: An excellent target for the government to squeeze tax revenue out of
options.c: Money In.

que2.question: Why is "Money In" such a strong philosophy?

options.a: Because money allows you to fix almost every other business problem. Without money your business dies.
options.b: Because money is the root of all evil. So if you make enough money you're doing your part of rooting out evil. Kind of.
options.c: It's actually really not a great idea. A real business makes sure to handle every other detail before they start taking orders. Can't be charging money if you don't have at least a decent office setup in a prime location.

que2.question: What is important to remember when you test an idea?

options.a: Don't test new ideas. Just look at what your competition is doing and do the same thing but... cheaper! That's a great way to run a business.
options.b: Test small to see if it works, then roll out big.
options.c: Go big or go home. Only a pussy would test small. A real G always pushes all of his chips in at every opportunity.

que3.question: What is a limiting belief people have about testing business ideas?

options.a: Testing new ideas and businesses is never worth it, best to just stick to what everyone else does.
options.b: Testing new ideas and businesses is expensive.
options.c: Testing new ideas and businesses is not worth it.

que3.question: What should be the driving question behind any idea you test?

options.a: Why did dinosaurs have little puny arms?
options.b: How do I get money in?
options.c: What will my grandmother think of me?
options.d: How can I make sure this doesn't fail?

que3.question: How do you build a portfolio and proof of work when you're starting from scratch?

options.a: Tell every client that you've never done this before and that they will be the first ones. They love hearing that stuff, really breeds confidence.
options.b: Don't worry about building up a body of work. Prospects don't care about that. Just wing it and hope for the best.
options.c: Take massive action, generate forward momentum, roll every success and experience into the next one until you have a body of work.
options.d: Lie and just make up random stuff. It'll be fine... right?

que4.question: What quality allows you to crush it in any business in any industry?

options.a: Creativity and a willingness to go against conventional wisdom
options.b: A massive budget and a staff of Harvard trained executives
options.c: Balls and a willingness to keep moving forward

que4.question: Why does it make sense to work with (close) friends and family?

options.a: You don't have to pay them, they'll work just to do you a favor.
options.b: They're closest by so you don't have to look very far. Nice and convenient.
options.c: It doesn't make sense. Never work with friends and family. Recipe for disaster.
options.d: They're least likely to stab you in the back and success is better if you do it together.

que4.question: Does it make sense to pool your resources in business and life?

options.a: Yes, it will allow you to do more, be more and have more while using your resource pool in the most efficient way
options.b: No, you should focus on owning everything and not sharing anything. Can't be sharing your toys, can you?
options.c: Yes, you can just coast off of other people's efforts. Works great (for a while).
options.d: No, you should have everything in your name for legal reasons. If you don't, someone will backstab you and run away with your stuff.

que5.question: When selling something, what does the prospect have to buy into first

options.a: You
options.b: Your company
options.c: Your product

que5.question: If you want to be convincing, you have to be...

options.a: ...Andrew Tate
options.b: ...a one-legged midget
options.c: ...physically strong

que5.question: Why is physical fitness important in business

options.a: Because it subconsciously communicates your word means something.
options.b: Because you can only sell something if you're ripped
options.c: Because your clients will know you're unlikely to spontaneously die during negotiations
options.d: Because you can beat people up when they say no.

que6.question: What is the easiest way to squeeze more profit out of your business?

options.a: Sell your kidney and other non-vital organs
options.b: Liquidate all assets, go to the casino and place EVERYTHING on number 38. Obviously.
options.c: Sell more to existing customers

que6.question: The three ways to grow a business are:

options.a: Door-to-door selling, Google Ads and Radio Advertising
options.b: Crush the enemy, see them driven before you, hear the lamentation of their women
options.c: Find new customers, increase transaction size, sell more to existing customers

que6.question: What is the LEAST profitable transaction in any sales cycle?

options.a: The third transaction
options.b: Any transaction after the first
options.c: All of them, because getting customers always costs money

que7.question: What's the main problem with getting legal before you get money in?

options.a: You're confusing meaningless activity with meaningful progress
options.b: There's no problem, you have to get legal first. Otherwise the success police will raid your home, kill your dog and take you to jail forever
options.c: They're both important so you should do them both at the same time

que7.question: How should you handle legal questions when you start a business?

options.a: Just ignore that completely and never bother with legal stuff at all.
options.b: You place them on the shelf until your idea has proven itself in the form of positive cashflow. Then you can handle the legalities.
options.c: You take your time to carefully research all of the legal ramifications and possible complications before you start anything.
options.d: You consult an attorney and/or an accountant as soon as possible.

que7.question: What is the BEST feeling in the world for a businessman?

options.a: Getting money IN.
options.b: hat kick-ass high you get when you write your terms and conditions.
options.c: Talking to lawyers, accountants and other pencil pushers.
options.d: Browsing through different luxury cars and boats to decide which one you're going to buy as soon as you get rich.

que8.question: How can you get money in without incurring high costs?

options.a: Profit from the skills you already have. Look for low-cost or free options such as the people already in your circle. Convince them to work for you and that you will take care of all the formalities.
options.b: Approach the hotties at your local club and tell them that you’ll make them millionaires if they let you film them in your basement. It will only cost you a few cans of tuna in the first couple of months.
options.c: You can’t. Every successful business out there starts with a considerable amount of financial, personnel, and resource investment. If you want to make lots of money, you must spend lots of money.

que8.question: As a hustler, how would you go about making things happen, not overthinking, and overcoming obstacles?

options.a: Be creative and make a list of all your available resources. Use what you have. What aren’t you doing but could? Who do you know, and what skills do you have? Use your brain and imagination.
options.b: Don’t worry about it! After joining Millionaire Access you’ll meet Tate and he already has a custom-designed life plan waiting for you. Dental included!
options.c: You take your time to carefully research all of the legal ramifications and possible complications before you start anything.
options.d: You should watch every YT video on sales and read every business book you can get your hands on. Take notes, and then DM the professors with questions. They will admire your dedication and reward you with extra points.

que8.question: How easy it is for you to sell your ideas to people?

options.a: Selling ideas to people can be especially challenging if the idea is significantly different from what they are used to, or if it requires them to change their behavior in some way. Most times you won’t be able to.
options.b: Making their lives easier and solving any problem they are currently facing will allow you to sell them anything.
options.c: Make sure you call, email, and DM them every day. And if they keep ignoring or flat out rejecting your ideas, show up at their company and pressure the staff to book you a meeting with the CEO.

que9.question: What is the magic rule for staff?

options.a: They should be highly attractive and ambitious. You want them to give you status and make you look smart.
options.b: Staff either save you time or make you money. Otherwise, you don't need them.
options.c: Don’t allow them access to social media. They’ll have to use Wikipedia instead and finally learn something useful that can improve their lives.

que9.question: How do you teach staff your business principles?

options.a: Don’t compromise and set an example for others. Communicate your business principles clearly and consistently.
options.b: You should have daily meetings with your staff, one hour before or after work, and remind them of the correct business procedures.
options.c: You take your time to carefully research all of the legal ramifications and possible complications before you start anything.
options.d: The quickest way is for you to wave a double-edged sword during staff meetings. That will guarantee they pay attention and understand how to be efficient.

que9.question: Why is it important to work fast?

options.a: If you finish all your tasks quickly you can go home or to the pub earlier.
options.b: Screw quality! Everything is made in China anyway. Be quick so you can sell tons. You only need people to buy from you once.
options.c: By working fast, you can increase your productivity and get more done in a given amount of time. Also, if you work faster than your competitors, you can differentiate your business and gain an edge over them.

que10.question: Should you hire a company to do your work?

options.a:
Definitely! Companies are cheaper and much more efficient.
B  -
C You should always hire a company that has a large number of seasoned professionals. Also, make sure that they still use PowerPoint for presentations.
options.b: No! They are not really interested in making you rich. A company is primarily interested in making itself rich. Hire a student or a freelancer instead. They are cheaper and eager to work.
options.c: You should always hire a company that has a large number of seasoned professionals. Also, make sure that they still use PowerPoint for presentations.

que10.question: What is a company’s primary goal?

options.a: Their primary goal is to find as many clients as possible and make money. Their attention will be split between many clients. They won’t be focused on you alone.
options.b: World dominance and influence. Just google “Blackrock” and you’ll understand what we mean.
options.c: To dedicate the entire staff’s attention to you and your business. They usually enforce a first come, first served policy.

que10.question: What are some advantages of hiring a student?

options.a: They’re as cheap as a canned tuna sandwich, as broke as Humpty Dumpty, and as needy as a Chihuahua. They will literally do anything you tell them for pennies.
options.b: It will allow you to save on taxes and social security.
options.c: Students are often willing to work for lower wages, which can be beneficial for businesses with limited budgets. Hiring a student can also be an opportunity to identify and groom loyal long-term employees.

que11.question: How can you manage your reputation?

options.a: If you make a mistake, cover it as skillfully as possible. What the eyes don’t see, the heart doesn’t grieve over.
options.b: In general, if you do more good than bad, you will be OK!
options.c: Hire the best lawyer and accountant you can. Go to church or the temple every week. And if you really have to, avoid being seen in Amsterdam’s Red Light District.

que11.question: What is one thing you should never do when conducting business?

options.a: You shouldn’t sleep with the secretary. Remember Bill Clinton and Monica Lewinsky? Haram!
options.b: No matter how bad business is going, do not ignore negative comments or people’s complaints! Take criticism and manage the situation accordingly.
options.c: Using aggressive or manipulative sales tactics.

que11.question: If someone is unhappy with your services it’s a good idea to…

options.a: You should blame the customer or make them feel like it’s their fault. Use reverse psychology on the annoying prick.
options.b: You should give them their money back. Say something simple like “I’m sorry it didn’t work out, I wish you all the best.
options.c: You should always use either aggressive or defensive language. Also, refuse to offer a resolution or compensation.

que12.question: How can you change the way you think about money?

options.a: A Prioritize saving! Make it a priority and try to set aside a portion of your income each month.
options.b: Be realistic about your financial situation and don't compare yourself to others. If needed, consider seeking professional help from a financial advisor or therapist who can provide guidance and support.
options.c: You must think about money all of the time! Educate yourself about it and always look at the world through a money lens.

que12.question: What is a helpful mind hack to start learning about business?

options.a: A classic university education is still the best path you can take. Just enroll in a business course and network with other students and their parents. They are probably all filthy rich.
options.b: Train your mind to analyze every business you interact with, even if you don’t know anything about it. What works for them? What are their expenses and profit margins? What’s failing and how could it be improved?
options.c: Invest in opening a fast-food franchise. They’ve basically done all the work for you. Dealing with staff is going to be your only problem.

que12.question: How can you benefit from observing how other businesses operate?

options.a: You can copy their business model and open your own in the same area. Then you employ a bunch of cute girls and steal most of their clients. You will be driving to the bank with a wider smile than the Cheshire cat’s.
options.b: Overall, observing other businesses will provide valuable insights and information that can help you make more informed decisions and improve the chances of success for your own business.
options.c: It’s mostly useful for spotting trends and sparking creative business ideas.

que13.question: What is one way you can do your job better?

options.a: You should always try to multitask and complete chores as fast as you can to exceed all expectations.
options.b: Use your creativity and make a list of all the things you could do to improve the business. Present it to your boss as a risk-free offer.
options.c: You should seek feedback and criticism from your co-workers before delivering anything. They have a keen interest in helping you grow and succeed.

que13.question: Should you quit your job and fully focus on your side hustle?

options.a: Absolutely! If you are inside Millionaire Access and are already implementing our lessons, a regular job is a complete waste of your time.
options.b: There are only enough hours in the day. Plus, you need beauty sleep. Focus on one thing bro! Either Millionaire Access, or the “normie” life. Can’t do both!
options.c: You shouldn’t quit your job immediately. You have enough time in the day to continue with it and get your side hustle rolling at the same time. Quit only when you have a steady stream of money coming in.

que13.question: Can you handle the stress of doing more than one task at a time??

options.a: Life is stressful. Embrace the stress! It sucks, but that’s awesome!
options.b: If you ever worked in a kitchen under a chef like Gordon Ramsay, your biggest problem should be dealing with boredom. Stress… what a joke!
options.c: You are a Millionaire Access student. A working machine, incapable of feeling stress or multitasking in the way that other humans do.
